claim: A video authentically shows Oscar-winning actor Emma Stone calling stand-up comedian Jo Koy an "a--hole" for making a joke about Taylor Swift.
content:
On Jan. 8, 2024, a user on X posted a video of Oscar-winning actor Emma Stone purportedly saying of stand-up comedian Jo Koy, who had just hosted the previous night's 81st annual Golden Globe Awards, "What an a--hole." According to the post, after the awards show and while taking questions from members of the press, Stone had called Koy an "a--hole" for making a joke during the broadcast about Taylor Swift.
"#EmmaStone saying a--hole to Jo Koy after her [his] jokes about #TaylorSwift," the post read.
However, while it's certainly possible that Stone was displeased with a joke that Koy had made about Swift, this rumor about her calling him a vulgar word was not true. The video was real but the caption was misleading. For rumors such as this one, we apply a rating of "Miscaptioned" rather than "False."
The same video was shared by The Hollywood Reporter with the caption, "Emma Stone jokes about getting Taylor Swift’s support at the #GoldenGlobes."
Emma Stone jokes about getting Taylor Swift’s support at the #GoldenGlobes pic.twitter.com/GjlnCkXKDR
— The Hollywood Reporter (@THR) January 8, 2024

Entertainment Tonight posted a complete video of the question that a reporter had asked of Stone:
REPORTER: Emma, I don't know if you noticed, but when you won, Taylor Swift gave you a huge applause. What are your thoughts on her cheering your win?
STONE: (joking) What an a--hole, am I right? No, I've known her for almost 20 years, so I was very happy she was there. And she was also nominated tonight, which was wonderful. And, yes. What an a--hole.
The full moment begins at the 2:54 mark in the video below.

During the Golden Globes broadcast, Stone won the best actress in a musical or comedy award for her role as Bella Baxter in the film "Poor Things." The movie also won the night's award for best comedy or musical.
Swift attended the awards ceremony after being nominated for her concert movie "Taylor Swift: The Eras Tour" in a new category dubbed “cinematic and box office achievement.” That honor was ultimately given to the film "Barbie."
Following the monologue, Koy made a joke about Swift, which resulted in her taking a sip of her drink. Part of his joke was, "The big difference between the Golden Globes and the NFL? On the Golden Globes, we have fewer camera shots of Taylor Swift. I swear. There's just more to go to."

As for Koy, his monologue was widely panned. For example, Hollywood reporter Brooke Barnes of The New York Times wrote that Koy's monologue was both "chaotic and sloppy," calling it "a train wreck."

At one point during his monologue, Koy added, with only a small bit of laughter and applause from the crowd, "Yo. I got the gig 10 days ago. You want a perfect monologue? Yo. Shut up. You guys – you're kidding me, right? Slow down. I wrote some of these, and they're the ones you're laughing at."

original_rationales.main_rationale: However, while it's certainly possible that Stone was displeased with a joke that Koy had made about Swift, this rumor about her calling him a vulgar word was not true. The video was real but the caption was misleading. For rumors such as this one, we apply a rating of "Miscaptioned" rather than "False."
original_rationales.additional_rationale1: At one point during his monologue, Koy added, with only a small bit of laughter and applause from the crowd, "Yo. I got the gig 10 days ago. You want a perfect monologue? Yo. Shut up. You guys – you're kidding me, right? Slow down. I wrote some of these, and they're the ones you're laughing at."
original_rationales.additional_rationale2: For example, Hollywood reporter Brooke Barnes of The New York Times wrote that Koy's monologue was both "chaotic and sloppy," calling it "a train wreck."

summary_rationales.synthesized_rationale: The claim of a video showing Emma Stone calling Jo Koy an 'a--hole' for a Taylor Swift joke has been rated as 'Miscaptioned.' This rating is attributed to the video's caption misinterpreting Stone's jestful comment about Taylor Swift as a serious insult towards Jo Koy.

detailed_reasons.reason1: The video in question captures Emma Stone humorously responding to a reporter's question about Taylor Swift, where she refers to Swift playfully as an 'a--hole' in a jocular tone, signaling a friendly relationship, which contradicts the claim's assertion of Stone insulting Jo Koy.
detailed_reasons.reason2: Various reputable sources like Entertainment Tonight and The Hollywood Reporter provide accurate context to the video, clarifying that Emma Stone's comment was directed at Taylor Swift in jest and not at Jo Koy as insinuated by the miscaptioned post
detailed_reasons.reason3: Jo Koy's unfavorable monologue at the Golden Globes, criticized as 'chaotic and sloppy,' was unrelated to the incident involving Emma Stone, further emphasizing the misinterpretation in the video's caption that connected Stone's lighthearted banter with Koy's controversial performance.

evidence1:
Emma Stone jokes about getting Taylor Swift’s support at the #GoldenGlobes pic.twitter.com/GjlnCkXKDR
— The Hollywood Reporter (@THR) January 8, 2024

STONE: (joking) What an a--hole, am I right? No, I've known her for almost 20 years, so I was very happy she was there. And she was also nominated tonight, which was wonderful. And, yes. What an a--hole.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason1,evidence1>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale by showing Emma Stone jokingly talking about Taylor Swift, indicating a friendly and light-hearted interaction, which contradicts the claim that Stone insulted Jo Koy.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason2,evidence1>: Refute. The evidence directly contradicts the rationale, as it shows Emma Stone making a joke about Taylor Swift, not calling Jo Koy an 'a--hole' as claimed in the miscaptioned post.

relationship_with_evidence.<main_rationale,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly aligns with the rationale detail by showing that Emma Stone was joking when she called Jo Koy an 'a--hole' and clarified that she has known Taylor Swift for almost 20 years, demonstrating that the caption on the video was indeed misleading.

relationship_with_evidence.<additional_rationale1,evidence2>: Refute. The evidence provided shows Emma Stone jokingly referring to Taylor Swift as an 'a--hole' in a light-hearted manner, which contradicts the serious and critical tone of the rationale detail. This directly opposes the idea presented in the rationale.

relationship_with_evidence.<additional_rationale2,evidence2>: Refute. The evidence provided directly contradicts the rationale as it shows Emma Stone jokingly calling Taylor Swift an 'a--hole' in a friendly and joking manner, which opposes the implication of chaos and negativity suggested in Koy's monologue described in the rationale.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason1,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence provided directly aligns with the rationale detail by showcasing Emma Stone humorously referring to Taylor Swift as an 'a--hole' in a joking and friendly manner, supporting the claim that the interaction was light-hearted and not meant as an insult to Jo Koy.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason2,evidence2>: Supportive. The evidence directly supports the rationale detail by clarifying that Emma Stone's comment was jovial and directed at Taylor Swift, not Jo Koy as implied by the miscaptioned post.

relationship_with_evidence.<reason3,evidence2>: Refute. The evidence directly contradicts the rationale detail as it shows Emma Stone jokingly referring to Taylor Swift as an 'a--hole' in a lighthearted manner, indicating a friendly relationship between them rather than any animosity towards her, which opposes the idea of negative sentiment presented in Jo Koy's monologue at the Golden Globes.
